provides input on requirement and design documents; assesses requirements for testability, clarity, purpose, inherent ambiguity, contradictory functions, and implementation.</li><li>Develops, documents, and leads the Defect Management process.</li><li>Ensures test cases are traceable to originating story/requirement and those tests fully test feature requirements and/or user story acceptance criteria.</li><li>Manages defects appropriately by assigning, monitoring, and providing timely communication through the defect lifecycle.</li><li>Conducts QA risk management process throughout the test plan phase defining and differentiating between risk, defect, and issue.</li><li>Assists teammates in growing and developing the skills necessary to grasp application concepts and tool suite.</li><li>Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions.</li><li>Coordinates and oversees test team activities for in-house, onshore, and offshore testing of multiple initiatives.</li><li>Participates in requirements and user story review; ensures the appropriate acceptance criteria are included and approved globally.</li><li>Creates and gains project approval on project test plans.</li><li>Creates and/or oversees the creation and approval of project test cases and QA-related documentation.</li><li>Executes tests and records results; works with others to identify and resolve defects.</li><li>Assists with automating and executes automated test cases.</li><li>Oversees or generates all QA-related documentation.</li><li>Ensures adherence to standardized QA policies, processes, and documentation standards.</li><li>Ensures that QA processes and procedures for test environments are followed, and that the integrity of the various environments are not compromised.</li><li>Executes test cases, defect management, and adherence to test schedule.</li><li>Attends and/or facilitates daily standup meetings and provides status updates.</li><li>Provides weekly QA project status reports.</li><li>Helps to mentor and develop skills in others.</li><li>Attends all sprint completion meetings and demos to stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum 5 years’ experience in software testing and leadership capacity.</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ functional and back-end testing of eCommerce websites and backend applications.</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools.</li><li>Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology, as well as experience testing on an Agile team.</li><li>Experience leading QA teams.</li><li>Experience in eCommerce Solutions, specifically SAP Commerce Platforms.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills.</li><li>Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans.</li><li>Ability to produce effective software test plans and test cases.</li><li>Familiar with source code, version management, and code deployment standards; and ability to utilizes this knowledge.</li><li>Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards.</li><li>High level understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts.</li><li>Ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision.</li><li>Strong communication skills with ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from senior management down to staff level.</li><li>Proven leadership skills; demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization.</li><li>Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and excellent collaboration skills.</li><li>Flexible; able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines.</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel internationally and adjust work hours to accommodate international teams.</li><li>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business in a 24x7x365 operations environment - evening, weekend, and holiday work.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science or in a related technical field preferred.</li><li>2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge.</li><li>Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions.</li><li>SQA experience working within an iterative development framework.</li><li>Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, and Mandarin is a plus.</li><li>Proficient in the use of Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, and analytics.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 3 - $105,000 - $135,000<p><br></p>Level 4 - $125,000 - $160,000<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas .

title: Microsoft Collaboration Solutions Engineer
description: <strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Perkins Coie, we look for self-motivated individuals, dedicated to providing value and superior service, and above all, have a high degree of integrity and enthusiasm for their work. We have created a company culture based on collaboration, devotion to serving our clients, and mutual respect. Perkins Coie is committed to advancing diversity and inclusion both within the firm and throughout our collective communities. Work with one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For and receive great health insurance, tuition reimbursement, and paid sabbaticals.<p><br></p><strong>GENERAL PURPOSE</strong><p><br></p>The Microsoft Collaboration Solutions Engineer will help drive our platform strategy for our Microsoft SharePoint, Teams, and Power platforms. The engineer will design, develop, maintain, and support the firm’s Microsoft 365 (M365) platform including SharePoint Online, SharePoint Server 2016, Teams, Power Apps/Automate, and associated third-party applications. This includes developing and supporting custom solutions built on the M365 platforms. The engineer will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, assess feasibility, and if necessary, collaborate with other platform owners to develop a solution. The engineer will work collaboratively with others within the Technology Department to ensure the platform is managed in accordance with the firm’s standards for data and security.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Functions</strong><p><br></p>These essential functions are primary job duties that incumbents must be able to perform unassisted or with some reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><ul><li>Act as the platform owner for SharePoint, Teams, and Power Automate. This includes establishing roadmaps, administering and maintaining the platform, managing security, and resolving issues.</li><li>Use, maintain, and support third-party applications such as Aderant Handshake, ShareGate, and Intapp Workspaces (Resptor) that are used to extend and support the platform.</li><li>Partner with the Technology Department and business leadership to identify priorities and project initiatives consistent with the firm’s strategic plan and roadmaps.</li><li>Work with all levels of the business to understand and assess their business requirements and determine the optimal, cost-effective solution consistent with their requirements. This may not always be the M365 platform.</li><li>Assist with the administration, maintenance, and support of the firm intranet.</li><li>Create technical documentation for solutions and procedures.</li><li>Stay current on M365 capabilities and roadmap by regularly engaging with Microsoft, attending seminars, training, etc.</li><li>Perform other duties, as assigned.</li><li>Be present at work during regularly scheduled working hours and as needed in the position, consistent with the firm’s attendance expectations.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>TRAVEL</strong><p><br></p>This position may require occasional travel to Perkins Coie offices, vendors, or conferences.<p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building SharePoint applications including web parts, workflows, and third-party interfaces.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of using the M365 platform to produce practical solutions for business needs.</li><li>Strong technical problem-solving that can adeptly administer, support, and maintain a hybrid (on-premises and cloud) SharePoint system.</li><li>Advanced knowledge of SharePoint security including permissions and guest access management.</li><li>Ability to create and debug automated workflows using Power Automate.</li><li>Ability to create and debug Power Apps solutions.</li><li>Strong SharePoint PowerShell module experience.</li><li>Working knowledge of Microsoft SQL. Ability to create stored procedures.</li><li>Comprehensive understanding of web technologies. Knowledge level must be appropriate for both troubleshooting and administration of SharePoint.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Specific Skills Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience building and supporting Power Apps solutions.</li><li>Experience with interfacing M365 with ServiceNow.</li><li>Working knowledge of HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS.</li><li>Knowledge of performance tuning and monitoring techniques.</li><li>Experience with SSO, Okta preferred.</li><li>Experience integrating with Azure resources.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education And Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Five plus years of experience developing and supporting SharePoint Server 2016 solutions.</li><li>Two plus years of experience developing and supporting SharePoint Online solutions.</li><li>Two plus years of experience developing and supporting Microsoft Teams solutions.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>This position is eligible for an annual discretionary bonus, 401(k) plan, medical, dental, and vision insurance, accrued paid time off plan starting at 20 days annually, personal medical and parental leave, up to ten paid Holidays, and family care benefits. More information regarding benefits and programs may be found</em><em> here</em><em>.</em><p><br></p><em>Perkins Coie encourages all interested applicants located near any of our office locations to apply</em><em>. This position may be filled in the following location(s). The compensation depends on qualifications and experience.</em><p><br></p><em>Colorado compensation range: $86,480 to $135,360 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Los Angeles compensation range: $100,710 to $157,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>San Diego compensation range: $99,430 to $155,640 annually</em><p><br></p><em>Washington State compensation range: $91,220 to $142,790 annually</em><p><br></p>#TechDept<p><br></p>

description: At AlixPartners, we solve the most complex and critical challenges by moving quickly from analysis to action when it really matters; creating value that has a lasting impact on companies, their people, and the communities they serve. By understanding, respecting, and honoring the needs of our employees, clients, and communities, AlixPartners actively promotes an inclusive environment. We strongly believe in the value that diversity brings to our experiences and are committed to the perpetual enhancements of initiatives, policies, and practices. We hold ourselves accountable by providing the space for authenticity, growth, and equity for everyone.<p><br></p>AlixPartners has embraced a hybrid work model to provide flexibility and support our employees’ work-life integration. Our hybrid model combines a mix of in-person at an AlixPartners office and remote working.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Do</u></strong><p><br></p>As a member of the Information Security (IS) team, the Security Operations Senior Analyst will contribute to the overall cyber defense of information assets and will conduct security monitoring, detection engineering, threat hunting, application of threat intelligence to improve preventative and detective controls, and perform incident response investigations.<p><br></p>The Security Operations Senior Analyst is a full-time position located in Southfield, MI, Chicago, IL, or Dallas TX reporting to the Security Operations Team Lead. Paid relocation is not available.<p><br></p><ul><li>Respond to, investigate, and analyze security events to determine appropriate actions</li><li>Analyze security system logs, security tools, and available data sources on a regular basis to identify attacks against the enterprise and report on any irregularities, issues related to improper access patterns, trending, and event correlations</li><li>Conduct and apply detection engineering concepts to analyze, create, and tune detection logic and telemetry to ensure effective coverage and detection of existing and emerging threats</li><li>Gather information from other IT staff and non-IT staff to obtain information regarding security problems to networks, servers, endpoints, and applications.</li><li>Perform incident response activities and ensure that proper protection or corrective measures have been taken when an incident has been discovered</li><li>Assist with administration of information security controls and software such as endpoint protection, endpoint detection and response, intrusion detection/prevention (IDS/IPS), security incident and event management (SIEM), data loss prevention (DLP), and physical security systems</li><li>Expected to stay current on security industry trends, new threats and attack techniques, mitigation techniques, and emerging security technologies</li><li>Provide insight and participate in security projects to evaluate and recommend security products for various applications and platforms throughout the organization while supporting business initiatives</li><li>Assist with the development, maintenance of, and training on technical documentation and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).</li><li>Improve security efficiency and streamline/automate work processes while working collaboratively with other team members and IT staff to accomplish objectives</li><li>Participate in critical incidents and implementation reviews</li><li>Additional responsibilities as identified. This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties, or responsibilities</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Need</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Highly motivated to work in information security</li><li>Minimum four (4) years of Information Security experience, or experience working in Information Technology</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology or related field preferred; work experience and background may be considered in lieu of formal education</li><li>Proven experience creating detection logic, SIEM rules, custom detections within EDR tools, etc.</li><li>Desire to continuously improve processes and procedures and share information with the team</li><li>Collaborative interpersonal skills with the ability to work well as an individual and as part of a team</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and any other local office language(s)</li><li>Ability to provide formal reports and presentations to people at all levels</li><li>High attention to detail with the ability to be organized and prioritize tasks so work is completed in an accurate and timely manner under time constraints</li><li>Proficient knowledge of information systems security concepts and current information security trends and practices</li><li>Working knowledge of infrastructure security tools such as firewalls, network security monitoring, anti-malware, OS hardening, etc.</li><li>Experience integrating security tools through scripting, using API’s and improving existing processes through automated methods are a plus</li><li>Experience with Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) and Endpoint Security tools are a plus</li><li>Incident Response, Forensics, and Malware Analysis experience is a plus</li><li>System administration and security hardening experience is a plus</li><li>Cloud security experience is a plus</li><li>Security Certifications such as the following are a plus (Security+, CISSP, GIAC certifications)</li><li>Willingness to work outside of normal U.S. business hours, and as unique projects/needs arise</li><li>Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment; physically able to sit/stand at a computer and work in front of a computer screen for significant portions of the workday</li><li>Must become familiar with, and promote and abide by, our Core Values as defined by the AlixPartners’ Code of Conduct and foster an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization</li></ul><p><br></p>The firm offers a comprehensive benefits program including health, vision, dental, disability, 401K, tuition reimbursement, identity theft protection, and mental wellness support. Employees will also receive a generous paid leave policy including vacation/personal time starting at 5.67 hours per pay period, sick time up to 80 hours annually, parental leave, and twelve holidays.<p><br></p><em>AlixPartners is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. AlixPartners is a proud Silver award-winning Veteran Friendly Employer.</em><p><br></p>

collaboration.<br><br><strong>What you'll do: <br></strong><ul><li>A different kind of technical challenge: more than just another app, Hologram delivers internet to physical devices on the move all
